actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide that any individual may qualify for disability insurance benefits and the disability freeze if he has 20 quarters of coverage (and meets the other conditions of eligibility therefore), regardless of when such quarters were earned.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Provides that any individual may qualify for disability insurance benefits and the disability freeze under title II (Old-Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act if he has 20 quarters of coverage (and meets the other conditions of eligibility therefor), regardless of when such quarters were earned.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide that any individual may qualify for disability insurance benefits and the disability freeze if he has 20 quarters of coverage (and meets the other conditions of eligibility therefore), regardless of when such quarters were earned.
